title: HTML Elements
description: APIs Many web APIs use JSON to format the data they send and receive. Web Development JSON is commonly used in AJAX requests to exchange data with a web server. Configuration Files: Many applications use JSON to store configuration settings. Data Storage: JSON can be used as a lightweight alternative to XML for data interchange between systems. Let me know if you need more details on a specific use case.

title: Introduction to JSON
description: JSON stands for JavaScript Object Notation. It is a lightweight data interchange format that is easy for humans to read and write and easy for machines to parse and generate. It is often used to transmit data between a server and web application as text.

title: Working with JSON in JavaScript
description: JavaScript provides built-in methods for working with JSON, such as `JSON.parse()` for converting JSON strings into JavaScript objects and `JSON.stringify()` for converting JavaScript objects into JSON strings.
